required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Nutritional Intervention and Physical Activity Program Reduce Body Weight in Women Newly Diagnosed With Breast Cancer.
clinical_study.official_title: A Standardized Integral Nutritional Intervention 1 and Physical Activity Program

lead_sponsor.agency: Instituto de Investigación Hospital Universitario La Paz

clinical_study.source: Instituto de Investigación Hospital Universitario La Paz

brief_summary.textblock: To evaluate a nutritional intervention for women newly diagnosed with breast cancer on a weight control and physical activity program.

detailed_description.textblock:
56 women newly diagnosed with breast cancer from the Department of Medical Oncology of La Paz University Hospital, Madrid, Spain.
A nutritional and physical activity intervention program that consisted of two individual nutritional consults and five nutritional group lectures was conducted by physicians of the Nutrition Unit during one year.

primary_outcome.measure: To evaluate a nutritional intervention for women newly diagnosed with breast cancer 9 weight control and physical activity program.
primary_outcome.description: To examine the frequency of food consumption

arm_group.description: Individual nutritional intervention with two groupal sessions and physical activity.

intervention.description: A nutritional intervention program that consisted of two individual nutritional consults.
A nutritional and physical activity intervention program that consisted of two individual nutritional consults and five nutritional group lectures.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Years: ≥18
- Sex: Female
- Newly diagnosed breast cáncer
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patients who have disseminated disease.
- Associated eating behavior disorders.
- Patients with dementia, mental illness or decreased cognitive function.
- Consumption of drugs or substances to lose weight (except in those cases in which it is suspended 15 days before starting the study).
- Presence of disease that may interfere with weight loss: severe psychiatric illness, uncontrolled hypothyroidism.
- Pregnant or breastfeeding women.
